page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: THE LOCAL FARMING HAS UNTIL RECENTLY BEEN MIXED WITH A PREDOMINANCE OF DAIRY FARMING. THIS HAS DRASTICALLY CHANGED SINCE THE MILK QUOTA REALLOCATION OF 1984. MORE POTATOES ARE NOW GROWN AS WELL AS MORE BEEF STOCK REARING. GOATS AND SHEEP ARE ALSO MORE NUMEROUS. MOST OF THE FARMS ARE SMALL, WITH 180 ACRES BEING THE LARGEST AS OF NOW. SADLY, ONE FARM IS NOW FOR SALE DUE TO LIQUIDATION, WHILST ONE MORE IS PRECARIOUSLY SITUATED. THE WET SUMMER HAS ACCENTUATED THE DIFFICULTIES... HOWEVER, THE LAND IS GOOD AND THE AREA SHOULD CONTINUE TO PROSPER ONCE THE PRESENT ECONOMIC PLIGHT LESSENS. THE AREA WILL CONTINUE TO BE MAINLY AGRICULTURAL.
